title: Children in relative poverty
creator: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/office-for-national-statistics
summary: Percentage of children aged 0 to 15 living in relative low income families Before Housing Costs (BHC), UK, for financial years ending 2015 to 2024.
description:
This dataset shows the percentage of children aged 0 to 15 living in relative low income families Before Housing Costs (BHC), in the UK, for financial years ending 2015 to 2024.

### Coverage 

UK

#### Geography definition

Local Authority Districts and Unitary Authorities,
Regions,
Nations (Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland),
Country (UK)

### Source

 - United Kingdom: [Department for Work and Pensions](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics) 


### Source Notes and Caveats 
Relative low income is defined as a family in low income Before Housing Costs (BHC) in the reference year. A family must have claimed Child Benefit and at least one other household benefit (Universal Credit, tax credits, or Housing Benefit) at any point in the year to be classed as low income in these statistics.

Rates have been derived by dividing the number of children aged 0 to 15 in low income families by the number of all children aged 0-15 (sourced from latest available mid-year population estimates).
